issue.title: Compiling drcsim against gazebo default branch produces very low real time factor

content.raw:
More support for @iche033 's assertion that pull request #559 is to blame:

* Building gazebo from eea487f28348, just *before* merging pull request #559, plus drcsim from the drcsim_2.6 branch, `atlas_sandia_hands.launch` gives RTF of 0.85.
* Building gazebo from 251d77807aea, just *after* merging pull request #559, plus drcsim from the drcsim_2.6 branch, `atlas_sandia_hands.launch` gives RTF of 0.60.  

As a side note, in the second configuration, I also commented out the [call to InsertRobotOrigin](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/222b5b368663a4ad7a8cd3acd8c83d1a5ea652ca/gazebo/sdf/interface/parser_urdf.cc?at=default#cl-1904) so that the robot wouldn't be embedded in ground plane.

Anybody have a guess as to what in that pull request would affect performance?
content.html:
More support for @iche033 's assertion that pull request #559 is to blame:

  • Building gazebo from eea487f28348, just before merging pull request #559, plus drcsim from the drcsim_2.6 branch, atlas_sandia_hands.launch gives RTF of 0.85.
  • Building gazebo from 251d77807aea, just after merging pull request #559, plus drcsim from the drcsim_2.6 branch, atlas_sandia_hands.launch gives RTF of 0.60.

As a side note, in the second configuration, I also commented out the call to InsertRobotOrigin so that the robot wouldn't be embedded in ground plane.

Anybody have a guess as to what in that pull request would affect performance?
